intro: Zanthoxylum novae-zeelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand prickly ash, is a shrub or small tree native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its spiny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, berry-like fruits. Its leaves and fruits contain compounds that have been used traditionally by Māori for medicinal purposes. The plant thrives in coastal and forested areas, often growing in well-drained soils.
